etymologies: Old English clāfre, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch klaver and German Klee

definitions: a herbaceous plant of the pea family that has dense, globular flower heads, and leaves that are typically three-lobed. It is an important and widely grown fodder and rotational crop.

notes.text: Genus Trifolium, family Leguminosae: many species, in particular red clover (T. pratense) and the creeping white clover (T. repens)
